result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto J Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 26 days granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $107.97 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.

Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Course.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-Working hours with Standard Release Conditions-All 60 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 120 days.

records.addlTxt: WCS Day Report Center Completion Notice.

DRC Informational Court Report.
Reviewed by the Court, WCS Day Report to restart as of the defendant's release date from Milwaukee.

Filed by Attorney Smith requesting that the defendant be able to serve his balance of Day Report Center in Milwaukee County.

The Court approves the defendant being able to comply with Day Report Center in Milwaukee County as long as Milwaukee County Day Report Center will accept the defendant into there program.

DRC Informational Court Report.
Reviewed by the Court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Roberto J Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- 6 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED.  Credit for 26 days if revoked.
- 1 year Probation. 
- Court costs of $253.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Restitution of $107.97 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Course.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.  
CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - All 60 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 120 days.
Motion hearing on February 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction and/or Modification.

Defendant Roberto J Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has not yet received discovery.  Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Wal Mart stores.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Roberto J Perez in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
